Chip In

  • deliverable: interactive prototype
  • role: visual & ux design
  • problem: itâ€™s time-consuming and difficult to find and organize donation drives in small communities.
  • methods: personas, wireframes, contextual inquiry, interviews, mscw
  • artifacts: process documents

Solution:

Chip In was a collaboration between myself and four other students in a User Interface Design and Development course. This class reinforced some of the core concepts of HCI, but also dealt with a number of great UX methodologies. Our team went through the entire design process from research to prototyping, and ended up with a project that evolved a considerable amount over the course of the semester. Sure, this project taught me how to whip up personas, scenarios, and interactive paper prototypes - but more importantly, I think it taught me the importance of flexibility in the design process - oh, and good documentation!
